description: Coin grade modifier registry. Documents special designations, surface characteristics, and variety indicators that supplement base grades.

modifiers.name: Cameo
modifiers.description: Frosted devices contrasting with mirror-like fields on proof coins
modifiers.notes: Less dramatic contrast than Deep Cameo. More common on modern proofs.

modifiers.name: Deep Cameo
modifiers.description: Heavily frosted devices with deep mirror fields, dramatic high-contrast appearance
modifiers.notes: NGC uses 'UC' or 'UCAM' (Ultra Cameo), PCGS uses 'DCAM'. Highly sought after, especially on classic commemoratives and early proof sets.

modifiers.name: Full Bands
modifiers.description: Complete separation of horizontal bands visible on torch of Mercury Dime reverse
modifiers.notes: Significant premium for this designation on Mercury Dimes. Requires complete separation of all horizontal bands on the fasces (bundle of rods) on the reverse. Very difficult to achieve on certain dates.

modifiers.name: Full Head
modifiers.description: Complete detail visible on Liberty's head, including all hair strands
modifiers.notes: Extremely difficult to achieve due to high relief design and die wear. Premium designation for Standing Liberty Quarters. Requires complete detail on head, including three hair strands across forehead.

modifiers.name: Full Steps
modifiers.description: Complete detail on all steps of Monticello building
modifiers.notes: Requires complete, unbroken horizontal lines on all 5 or 6 steps of Monticello. PCGS typically uses '5FS' or '6FS' to indicate number of full steps. More common on modern issues.

variants.5FS: Five Full Steps - complete separation of 5 steps
variants.6FS: Six Full Steps - complete separation of all 6 steps (highest standard)

modifiers.name: Red
modifiers.description: Full original red mint luster with 95-100% red color, no brown toning
modifiers.notes: Copper coins only. Highest premium for color designation. Becomes increasingly rare on older coins. Must have 95% or more original red color.

modifiers.name: Red-Brown
modifiers.description: Mixed red and brown coloration, 5-95% red luster remaining
modifiers.notes: Copper coins only. Intermediate premium between Brown and Red. Natural transition state as copper tones over time. Must have 5-95% original red color.

modifiers.name: Brown
modifiers.description: Fully brown or nearly fully brown patina, less than 5% red remaining
modifiers.notes: Copper coins only. Lowest premium but can still be very attractive with even, rich chocolate brown toning. Common on older copper coins. Less than 5% original red color.

modifiers.name: Prooflike
modifiers.description: Business strike coin with mirror-like fields resembling a proof
modifiers.notes: NGC designation only. Business strikes with mirror-like reflective fields, typically from early die state. Common on Morgan Dollars and some modern issues.

service_specific.PCGS: Describes as 'prooflike' in holder text but no formal PL designation

modifiers.name: Deep Prooflike
modifiers.description: Business strike with deeply mirrored proof-like fields, strong contrast
modifiers.notes: Deep mirror-like reflective fields on business strikes. More dramatic than standard PL. Both services recognize this designation. Particularly desirable on Morgan Dollars.

modifiers.name: Full Bell Lines
modifiers.description: Complete separation of horizontal lines on Liberty Bell
modifiers.notes: Requires complete separation of all horizontal lines on Liberty Bell at bottom. Difficult to achieve due to die placement opposite Kennedy's head on obverse.

modifiers.name: Full Details Centavo
modifiers.notes: Requires complete detail on shield design. Less commonly used designation.

modifiers.name: Star Designation
modifiers.description: Exceptional eye appeal and aesthetic quality beyond typical grade
applies_to_grades: Any grade MS-60 and above, PR-60 and above
modifiers.notes: NGC-specific designation indicated by a star (*) symbol. Subjective assessment of superior eye appeal, color, and overall aesthetic quality.

modifiers.name: Plus Designation
modifiers.description: Superior quality within the assigned grade, could potentially upgrade
modifiers.notes: PCGS-specific designation indicated by a plus (+) symbol. Indicates coin is at the high end of the grade range and shows exceptional quality for the assigned grade.

service_specific.NGC: Does not offer equivalent designation (uses Star instead)

category_definitions.surface_finish: Characteristics related to the coin's surface texture and appearance (CAM, DCAM, PL, DPL)
category_definitions.strike_quality: Designations for exceptional strike sharpness and detail (FB, FH, FS, FBL)
category_definitions.color_designation: Color classifications for copper coins (RD, RB, BN)

usage_guidelines.combining_modifiers: Some modifiers can be combined (e.g., 'MS-65 RD FB' for a Red Mercury Dime with Full Bands), but not all combinations are valid
usage_guidelines.service_differences: PCGS and NGC may use different codes for similar characteristics (e.g., DCAM vs UC, DMPL vs DPL)
usage_guidelines.market_impact: Modifiers can significantly increase coin value, with some designations (FB, FH, RD) doubling or tripling prices
usage_guidelines.verification: Always verify modifier designations on grading service website using certification number

invalid_combinations.reason: PL is for business strikes, DCAM is for proofs
FB designation only applies to Mercury Dimes

valid_combinations.description: Gem Uncirculated Red Mercury Dime with Full Bands
Near-perfect proof with Deep Cameo contrast
Premium Gem Red-Brown Jefferson Nickel with Five Full Steps
